header_summary: Davidson Souza shares his project Floresta, a compact Bitcoin full node for low-power devices.The BIP for Silent Payments undergoes review and revision, introducing significant changes to the protocol.Silent Payments protocol focuses on privacy and usability, enabling multiple outputs and CoinJoin techniques.A proposal aims to remove standardness restrictions on OP_Return outputs, allowing unlimited size and number.

recent_posts.title: Announcing Libforesta
recent_posts.summary:
- Davidson Souza shared his project, called Floresta, with the Bitcoin developers mailing list.
- Floresta is a compact, simple, and ready-to-use full node for end users, especially on low-power devices.
- Floresta project is available on Davidson's GitHub repository and welcomes feedback.

recent_posts.title: BIP352: Silent Payments
recent_posts.summary:
- The BIP for Silent Payments has undergone review and revision, including changes to key types and address encoding.
- The specification provides guidelines for scanning transactions, shared secret derivation, sender actions, and receiver actions.
- The protocol introduces a new address format and supports privacy-enhancing techniques like CoinJoin.

recent_posts.title: Pull-req to remove the arbitrary limits on OP_Return outputs
recent_posts.summary:
- Sjors Provoost suggests notifying the mailing list via email about merging a pull request.
- The pull request aims to remove restrictions on OP_Return outputs in transactions.
- Removing these restrictions could potentially create additional transaction pinning vectors.

recent_posts.title: Jamming Mitigation Dry Run
recent_posts.summary:
- Elias discusses the potential for re-identifying anonymized channel counterparties using multiple datasets.
- He suggests a long-term collection of proposed fields for insights into transferred amounts and channel liquidities.
- Elias proposes a common data format for analysis and raises concerns about data sensitivity.

recent_posts.title: Multipath Keysend
recent_posts.summary:
- ZmnSCPxj proposed a `keysend` protocol for multipath payments, ensuring payment claim after all parts arrive.
- The scheme suggests embedding preimage as TLV 5482373484 in the `keysend` with SHA256 hash.
- Receiver detects support for multipath `keysend` based on errors or holding onto incoming HTLCs.

recent_posts.title: Blinded Paths Doom Scenario
recent_posts.summary:
- Deanonymizing techniques on the Lightning Network only deanonymize the recipient, not the sender.
- Blinded paths can be used to preserve sender-side privacy in certain scenarios.
- The use of blinded paths raises concerns about privacy and decentralization on the network.

active_posts.title: Blinded 2-party Musig2
active_posts.summary:
- The implementation of 2-of-2 Schnorr Musig2 for statechains is being discussed.
- Party 1 should not learn certain information, including aggregate public key, aggregate signature, or message being signed.
- Party 2 performs key and nonce aggregation while party 1 remains blinded.

active_posts.title: Pull-req to enable Full-RBF by default
active_posts.summary:
- The author proposes enabling full-replace-by-fee (full-rbf) by default in Bitcoin Core.
- Block explorers, nodes, and wallets have already adopted and supported full-rbf functionality.
- The author suggests deprecating and removing all BIP125 code in future Bitcoin Core releases.

active_posts.title: Concern about "Inscriptions".
active_posts.summary:
- There is a significant bug in recent versions of the Bitcoin software regarding inscriptions.
- The bug is causing issues with the UTXO set and results in daily growth of approximately 25MB.
- There should be options to reject inscriptions in the mempool to mitigate their negative impact.

active_posts.title: HTLC Endorsement for Jamming Mitigation
active_posts.summary:
- The email updates about channel jamming and the upcoming call on May 1st.
- The group plans to gather data on HTLC endorsement and local reputation tracking for jamming prevention.
- The proposed reputation scheme involves tracking the reputation of direct neighbors to mitigate channel jamming.

active_posts.title: Potential vulnerability in Lightning backends: BOLT-11 "payment hash" does not commit to payment!
active_posts.summary:
- LNbits team patched an exploit allowing attackers to create balances by manipulating invoices.
- Users are urged to update to LNbits version 0.10.5 to prevent similar exploits.
- Attack involves inserting payment hash of one payment into another, deceiving the backend.

active_posts.title: LN Summit 2023 Notes
active_posts.summary:

- Attendees attempted to take transcript-style notes, available at this link: https://docs.google.com/document/d/1MZhAH82YLEXWz4bTnSQcdTQ03FpH4JpukK9Pm7V02bk/edit?usp=sharing.
